column1: #text=While riding down the street I got a flat tire on my bike .
#text=I found out for sure that the tire was actually flat by trying to fill it up and see if it held air .
#text=It did not stay inflated so I thought that I needed to replace the inner tube .
#text=I went and got my Dad 's adjustable wrench from the garage , hoping he would not be angry .
#text=I removed the wheel by loosening the two nuts using the wrench and almost caught my finger in the chain .
#text=After the wheel had been removed , I removed the tire and tube from the wheel rim and nearly cut my hand again .
#text=I removed the old -LRB- flat -RRB- inner tube and replace it with a new tube that I bought at the store down the street .
#text=The guy at the store said that if the hole was small enough , I could possibly patch the hole using a tire patch kit .
#text=I told the man that the hole was 2 inches long and he said I needed to replace the inner tube-but I already figured that out because it happened last summer too .
#text=When I finally had the new tube in the tire , I put the tire back on the rim and made sure that the tube stem was in the right place .
#text=I had some lemonade and then I put the wheel back on the bike and tightened the nuts .
#text=Then I inflated the tire and rode to my friend Steve 's house to play video games .
